div.head: To all such of the Congregation both men, woemen, and children o •… discretion that are of the English nation▪ residing at Hamborough that seeke, & serue god in sincerity vvithout hipocrisie or faction.
div.p:
BLessed, & beloued in the lord. The Christian sobriety▪ & cōfortable charitie vvhich I obserued in my table brothers occasioned the cōposing of these hymnes. It vvas their goodnes to make them publique for the benefitt of others also. They are all deuine songs, yea from meditations of the scripture are they dravvne. If you shall vse them in your priuate families to gods glorie,
•… ur ovvne solace, & to the instructiō, •… edification of your children I haue •… e end of my desire. Receaue them as •… e symptomes of my soules affection the generall aduancment of gods •… uice, to the priuate consolation of you your children, & to the praise, and •… nour of our ovvne mother tongue. •… us in the midest of manie harshe •… mes of grudge, and despite I haue •… arned to tune the songs of Sion. For vvhich I praise god, and shall neuer •… ase to pray for your blessednes in the •… uing mercies of Iesus Christ his •… uours. resting

closer.signed: Yours in the lord W. L.
